results.title: A Pair of moccasins for Mary Thomas
results.creator_credit: Geoff Voyce, B T Filmsound and National Indian Arts and Crafts
results.brief_description: We follow Mary Thomas, a Sioux Interior Salish Indian, as she makes a pair of moccasins, the most common Indian footwear and a part of Indian cultural heritage. Starting from the treating of animal hide, Mary uses traditional methods, right through to the finished product.
results.title_for_label: A Pair of moccasins for Mary Thomas
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoff Voyce, B T Filmsound and National Indian Arts and Crafts

results.title: Labor and childbirth
results.creator_credit: D.M. Hatfield and Photo & Sound Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Education for Childbirth”.
A young couple expects their first child. Shows onset of labor, the trip to the hospital, call to doctor, admission to maternity ward, routine preparations for delivery, including instructions to mother, and normal birth of child. Stresses the assumption that fear stems from lack of knowledge.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Education for Childbirth”.

results.title: Prenatal care
results.creator_credit: C Larrance, D.M. Hatfield and Photo & Sound Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Education for Childbirth”.
Through the prenatal care of three women in different stages of pregnancy, explains the need for medical examination and care, discusses correct diet, exercises for daily use, proper clothing, and a healthy attitude of mind.
results.creator_credit_for_label: C Larrance, D.M. Hatfield and Photo & Sound Productions

results.title: A Normal birth
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Education for Childbirth”.
A photographic record of an actual delivery depicting the normal processes of childbirth and the two final stages of labour. The preparation of the mother in the delivery room, the actual birth of the child, and the immediate post-birth care of both mother and child are shown.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Education for Childbirth”.
A photographic record of an actual delivery depicting the normal processes of childbirth and the two final stages of labour. The preparation of the mother in the delivery room, the actual birth of the child, and the immediate post-birth care of both mother and child are shown.

results.title: Supervising workers on the job
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, Caravel Films and United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Problems in supervision”
Various kinds of poor supervision practices are shown, among them, nagging, snooping, etc. By dramatised incidents, the poor results of these methods are made apparent and the better ways indicated.
results.creator_credit_for_label: F.E. Brooker, Caravel Films and United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids

results.title: Maintaining workers interest
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, Caravel Films and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems in Supervision”.
Various workers are shown doing poor work because their work holds no interest for them. The point is made that the supervisor should be alert to detect and remedy these situations wherever possible.
results.creator_credit_for_label: F.E. Brooker, Caravel Films and United States. Office of Education

results.title: Maintaining good working conditions
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, Mode-Art Pictures and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems in Supervision”.
Presents several cases where an improvement in working conditions resulted in increased production. The importance of the part which must be played by supervisors in maintaining good working conditions is stressed.

results.title: Maintaining quality standards
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, Mode-Art Pictures and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems in Supervision”.
Various scenes emphasise the nature of quality standards. The role of the supervisor in maintaining quality as well as quantity is made clear by incidents involving poor instruction, carelessness, and lack of pride in good workmanship.
results.creator_credit_for_label: F.E. Brooker, Mode-Art Pictures and United States. Office of Education
